comment.shortText:
ActivityContentError is a base class for other errors in the Activity Content package. All errors thrown
extending this class can be assumed to have originated in the Activity Content package, not
in any underlying adapters or higher level client code.

InvalidActivityContentError indicates that an activity content object failed
to pass validation.

ActivityContentAudio represents an audio clip attached to an
ActivityContentNote. ActivityContentAudio objects contain an array of
ActivityContentAudioLinks with different versions of the same content. For
example, a single item of audio content may be available in multiple formats,
such as OGG or MP3, which may be included as individual
ActivityContentAudioLink objects. The semantic content of each file should
always be identical.

ActivityContentAudioLink represents a specific audio file included in an
ActivityContentAudio object.

ActivtyContentHash represents a hash included in the hash field of an
ActivityContentAudioLink, ActivityContentImageLink or
ActivityContentVideoLink object to prove it's authenticity.

ActivityContentHashtag represents a hashtag associated with an
ActivityContentNote or an ActivityContentProfile.

ActivityContentImage represents an image file attached to an
ActivityContentNote. ActivityContentImage objects contain an array of
ActivityContentImageLinks with different versions of the same content. For
example, a single picture may be available in multiple formats, such as JPEG
or PNG, which may be included as individual ActivityContentImageLink
objects. The height and width of the included ActivityContentImageLink
objects may also vary to provide faster loading on different screen size
devices. The semantic content of each file should always be identical.

ActivityContentImageLink represents a specific image file included in an
ActivityContentImage object.

ActivityContentLink represents a link attached to an ActivityContentNote.
Unlike ActivityContentAudio, ActivityContentImage and ActivityContentVideo
objects, link objects may point to dynamic content, such as a news article,
which should not be hashed to prove their authenticity.

ActivityContentLocation represents location data associated with an
ActivityContentNote or ActivtyContentProfile.

ActivityContentMention represents a mention associated with an
ActivityContentNote or an ActivityContentProfile.
ActivityContentNote represents a post created by the user.
ActivityContentProfile represents profile data for the posting user.

ActivityContentVideo represents an video file attached to an
ActivityContentNote. ActivityContentVideoLink objects contain an array of
ActivityContentVideoLinks with different versions of the same content. For
example, a single video may be available in multiple formats, such as MPEG
or MKV, which may be included as individual ActivityContentVideoLink
objects. The height and width of the included ActivityContentVideoLink
objects may also vary to provide faster loading on different screen size
devices. The semantic content of each file should always be identical.

ActivityContentVideoLink represents a specific video file included in an
ActivityContentVideo object.

ActivityContentAttachment represents a piece of external content associated
with an ActivityContentNote, such as a picture, video, audio clip or website.

ActivityContentTag is either an ActivityContentHashtag or an
ActivityContentMention.

createAudioAttachment() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentAudio object.
An array of ActivityContentAudioLink objects to include
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentAudio

createAudioLink() provides a simple factory for generation an
ActivityContentAudioLink object for inclusion in an ActivityContentAudio
object.
The URL of the file
The MIME type of the file (see SUPPORTED_AUDIO_MEDIA_TYPES within validation.ts)
An ActivityContentHash object to authenticate the file
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentAudioLink

createHash() provides a simple factory for generating an ActivityContentHash
object. This factory assumes the user intends to use a standard Keccak256
hash. To use other authentication algorithms, users should build their own
ActivityContentHash objects.
comment.returns: An ActivityContentHash containing the keccak256 proof of the content

comment.shortText: The file content to be hashed

createHashtag() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentHashtag object.
The hashtag value, without "#" character

createImageAttachment() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentImage object.
An array of ActivityContentImageLink objects to include
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentImage

createImageLink() provides a simple factory for generation an
ActivityContentImageLink object for inclusion in an ActivityContentImage
object.
The URL of the file
The MIME type of the file (see SUPPORTED_IMAGE_MEDIA_TYPES within validation.ts)
An ActivityContentHash object to authenticate the file
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentImageLink

createLinkAttachment() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentLink object.
The URL to include in the link
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentLink

createLocation() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentLocation object.
This is the string provided for name of the Location
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentLocation

createMention() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentMention object.
The DSNPUserId of the mention user
Any additional fields for the ActivityContentMention

createNote() provides a simple factory for generating an ActivityContentNote
object.
The text content to include in the note
Overrides default fields for the ActivityContentNote

createProfile() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentProfile object.
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentProfile

createVideoAttachment() provides a simple factory for generating an
ActivityContentVideo object.
An array of ActivityContentVideoLink objects to include
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentVideo

createVideoLink() provides a simple factory for generation an
ActivityContentVideoLink object for inclusion in an ActivityContentVideo
object.
The URL of the file
The MIME type of the file (see SUPPORTED_VIDEO_MEDIA_TYPES within validation.ts)
An ActivityContentHash object to authenticate the file
Overrides any default fields for the ActivityContentVideoLink

isActivityContentNoteType is a non-throwing version of `requireIsActivityContentNoteType`
Performs the same checks but catches InvalidActivityContentError and returns false instead.
comment.returns: a boolean - indicating if the object is an ActivityContentNote

comment.shortText: The object to check

isActivityContentProfileType is a non-throwing version of `requireIsActivityContentProfileType`.
Performs the same checks but catches InvalidActivityContentError and returns false instead.
comment.returns: a boolean - indicating if the object is an ActivityContentProfile

comment.shortText: The object to check
isDSNPUserURI validates a given object as a DSNPUserURI.
comment.returns: True of false depending on whether the string is a valid DSNPUserURI

comment.shortText: The object to validate

requireGetSupportedContentAttachments iterates over the provided list and returns
the valid+supported attachments. If the passed in obj is empty, returns an empty array.
If there are attachments but none of them are valid+supported, it throws an error.
Attachments MUST first pass a type check to be considered valid at all.
comment.returns: an array of all valid ActivityContentAttachments

tags.text:
InvalidActivityContentError if there are no valid attachments with
supported Link attachments.

Examples:
1. One Image attachment with one URL that points to a TIFF file throws an error.
2. One Image attachment with two URLs, one that is a TIFF and the other is JPG,
   does not throw.
3. One Image attachment with two URLs, both are JPG, but one has a malformed
   hash of 0xdeadbeef (it's too short), throws an error due to failing
   the type check.
4. Two Image attachments, the one from #2 and the one from #3, does NOT throw and
   returns just #2.

comment.shortText: an array of unknown object types to check for validity

requireActivityContentNoteType() is a type check function for ActivityContentNote
objects. Note that this function only checks that the given object meets the
first-level type definition of an ActivityContentNote. It **does not** perform
deeper type validations or any logic
validations, such as checking the format of string fields or checking that
required attachments each include at least one supported format.
comment.returns: true if the object is an ActivityContentNote, otherwise throws an Error.

comment.shortText: The object to check

requireIsActivityContentProfileType() is a type check function for
ActivityContentProfile objects. Note that this function only checks that the
given object meets the first-level type definition of an ActivityContentProfile. It
does not** perform deeper type validations or any logic validations, such as checking the format of
string fields or checking that the icon field includes at least one supported
image format.
comment.returns: true if the object is an ActivityContentProfile,otherwise throws an Error

comment.shortText: The object to check

requireActivityContentAttachment validates an unknown object and returns it
as an ActivityContentAttachment type if valid, and throws an error if not.
the object to convert

requireValidActivityContentNote() validates that a given object meets all
necessary specification requirements for an ActivityContentNote object,
include string field formats and other logical validations. Note that this
function **does not** attempt to fetch any attachments to validate that their
hashes are correct.

tags.text: InvalidActivityContentError if not valid, with a message

comment.shortText: The object to check

requireValidActivityContentProfile() validates that a given object meets all
necessary specification requirements for an ActivityContentProfile object,
include string field formats and other logical validations. Note that this
function **does not** attempt to fetch any icons to validate that their
hashes are correct.

tags.text: InvalidActivityContentError if not valid, with a message

comment.shortText: The object to check
